settings.title: What is Gluten?
settings.desc:
Gluten is a protein found in wheat, rye, and barley. It can also be found in some processed foods and additives.

Gluten helps foods maintain their shape and stay together. For example, gluten helps give bread its chewy texture and helps pizza dough to rise.

For people with celiac disease or a non-celiac gluten sensitivity, ingesting gluten can cause serious discomfort and health problems.

settings.title: What is Gluten-Free?
settings.desc:
Gluten-free is a term used to describe food or drink that does not contain the protein gluten.

Gluten-free products are made without wheat, barley, or rye allowing them to be consumed safely by those with celiac disease or gluten sensitivity.
